entry.title: Easy-Ruby
entry.summary: A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write.
entry.content:
A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write.

1. Constant & Variable

my_name = "小明" // Variable
MyName = "小明" // Constant

2. Control Flow

day = 5

if day==0
	puts "星期日"
elsif day==6
	puts "星期六"
else
	puts "工作日"
end

3. Data Type

  • Number
  • String
  • Range
  • Array
  • Hash
  • Symbol

类型

puts 5.class  # => Integer

数字

puts 10 + 3    # => 13
puts 10 - 3    # => 7
puts 10 * 3    # => 30
puts 10 / 3    # => 3
puts 10.0 / 3  # => 3.3333333333333335
puts 10 / 3.0  # => 3.3333333333333335
puts 10 % 3    # => 1

字符串

name = "小明"
age = 18

puts "你好，我是" + name + "，我今年" + age.to_s + "岁" # => 你好，我是小明，我今年18岁

puts "你好，我是#{name}，我今年#{age}岁" # => 你好，我是小明，我今年18岁

范围

(1..5).to_a   # 1 到 5
(1...5).to_a  # 1 到 4

数组

thoughts = ["儒家", "道家", "墨家", "法家"]
p thoughts[1] # => 道家
p thoughts[-1] # => 法家
p thoughts.first # => 儒家
p thoughts.last # => 法家

字典

thought_hash = {
	儒家: "孔子",
	道家: "老子",
	墨家: "墨子"
}

puts thought_hash.keys  # => []
puts thought_hash.values # => []

profile.each do |key, value|
  puts key
  puts value
end

符号

=begin
  Symbol 是不可变的对象
	Symbol 是带变量名的对象
=end

:hello

3. Methods

def say_hello_to(name="美女")
	return "hello, #{name}"
end

p say_hello_to

4. Block

def say_hello
	puts "开始"
	yield 123        # 把控制权暂时让给 Block
	puts "结束"
end

say_hello { |x|
	puts "这里是 Block，我收到了#{x}"
}

5. Class

class Cat
  attr_accessor :name #属性 

  def initialize(name, gender)
    @name = name # 实例变量
    @gender = gender
  end
    
  def say_hello
    puts "hello, my name is #{@name}" # => hello, my name is kitty
  end
end

6. Module

module Flyable
  def fly
    puts "I can fly!"
  end
end

class Cat
  include Flyable
end

kitty = Cat.new
kitty.fly        # => I can fly!

entry.title: Mac-MySQL
entry.content:
Relational database.

1. MySQL

$ brew install mysql

or

$ brew install mysql@5.6

2. Info

We've installed your MySQL database without a root password. To secure it run:
    mysql_secure_installation

MySQL is configured to only allow connections from localhost by default

To connect run:
    mysql -uroot

To have launchd start mysql now and restart at login:
  brew services start mysql
Or, if you don't want/need a background service you can just run:
  mysql.server start

entry.title: gitmoji
entry.summary: An emoji guide for your commit messages
entry.content:
An emoji guide for your commit messages

1. System

emoji alias messages
🍎 :apple: Fixing something on macOS.
🐧 :penguin: Fixing something on Linux.
🏁 :checkered_flag: Fixing something on Windows.
🤖 :robot: Fixing something on Android.
🍏 :green_apple: Fixing something on iOS.

2. Project

emoji alias messages
🎉 :tada: Initial commit.
✨ :sparkles: Introducing new features.
📝 :pencil: Writing docs.
🐛 :bug: Fixing a bug.
🚑 :ambulance: Critical hotfix.
🔖 :bookmark: Releasing / Version tags.
🔊 :loud_sound: Adding logs.
🔇 :mute: Removing logs.
👥 :busts_in_silhouette: Adding contributor(s).
📸 :camera_flash: Adding or updating snapshots

3. File

emoji alias messages
🔥 :fire: Removing code or files.
💄 :lipstick: Updating the UI and style files.
🔧 :wrench: Changing configuration files.
📦 :package: Updating compiled files or packages.
🚚 :truck: Moving or renaming files.
🗃 :card_file_box: Performing database related changes.
🙈 :see_no_evil: Adding or updating a .gitignore file
💬 :speech_balloon: Updating text and literals.

4. Code

emoji alias messages
🎨 :art: Improving structure / format of the code.
🔥 :fire: Removing code or files.
📈 :chart_with_upwards_trend: Adding analytics or tracking code.
♻️ :recycle: Refactoring code.
💩 :poop: Writing bad code that needs to be improved.
👽 :alien: Updating code due to external API changes.
👌 :ok_hand: Updating code due to code review changes..
💡 :bulb: Documenting source code.
🍻 :beers: Writing code drunkenly.

5. Dependency

emoji alias messages
⬇️ :arrow_down: Downgrading dependencies.
⬆️ :arrow_up: Upgrading dependencies.
📌 :pushpin: Pinning dependencies to specific versions.
➕ :heavy_plus_sign: Adding a dependency.
➖ :heavy_minus_sign: Removing a dependency.

6. Optimize

emoji alias messages
⚡️ :zap: Improving performance.
♿️ :wheelchair: Improving accessibility.
🏗 :building_construction: Making architectural changes.
📱 :iphone: Working on responsive design.
🔍 :mag: Improving SEO
🚸 :children_crossing: Improving user experience / usability.

7. Deploy

emoji alias messages
🚀 :rocket: Deploying stuff.
💚 :green_heart: Fixing CI Build.
👷 :construction_worker: Adding CI build system.
🐳 :whale: Work about Docker.
☸️ :wheel_of_dharma: Work about Kubernetes

8. Other

emoji alias messages
✅ :white_check_mark: Updating tests.
🔒 :lock: Fixing security issues.
🗃 :card_file_box: Performing database related changes.
🤡 :clown_face: Mocking things.
🥚 :egg: Adding an easter egg.
⚗ :alembic: Experimenting new things

entry.title: Git
entry.summary: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.
entry.content:
Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

1. Install

$ brew install git
$ git --version

2. Configure

$ git config --global user.name "Your Actual Name"
$ git config --global user.email "Your Actual Email"
$ git config -l

3. Add & Commit

$ git add .
$ git commit -m "Commit message"

4. Push

$ git remote add origin <server>
$ git push origin master

5. Branch

$ git checkout -b feature_x
$ git checkout master
$ git branch -d feature_x
$ git push origin <branch>

6. Update & Merge

$ git pull
$ git merge <branch>

entry.title: NVM
